context: A possible attempt to access a Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was detected, potentially compromising Azure AD authentication on a Windows 10 device for the user `tgs2z` using the IP `107.224.99.179`. Moreover, in another related alert, there was an indication that all file snapshots and shadow copies were deleted through the utility `vssblatemp.exe`, which is a typical sign of a ransomware infection.
question: What was the command line used to delete the snapshots and shadow copies, and what is the process ID associated with this command?
gold_answer: Process ID: 5512, Command Line: vssblatemp.exe delete shadows /all
solution_steps: There was a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) using the process `browsercore.exe`.
There was another attempt to access the PRT by an account with SID `S-1-5-21-1840191660-8534830288-125585561-1522`.
File backups were deleted using the process `vssblatemp.exe` with the command line `delete shadows /all` at `2024-06-20t09:10:50.2899021z`, with Process ID `5512`.
